page.title: 11Entertainment
page.content: THE SCOTTISH WOMEN'S RURAL INSTITUTE (CRAIL BRANCH) exists to provide social, educational and recreational opportunities for those who live or work in the country, or are interested in country life. Members pay an Annual Subscription, and monthly for tea at meetings. Competitions encourage crafts. Slide talks, fashion outings and demonstrations, inter-institute visits are held. There are competitions in bowling, golf, curling, drama and music.We help to preserve the beauties and traditions of rural Scotland, and work for peace and international understanding and goodwill. THE MONDAY CLUB, as its name suggests, meets weekly and supplies a variety of entertainment organised by a committee.After the entertainment and tea cards and dominoes are played.
